column2: IDAHO DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Idaho

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Better concentration
column8: Improved coordination

column2: 2. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Return gestures and shouts.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 3. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 4. When driving through a curve, you should:
column4: slow as you enter, speed up as you exit.
column6: stay near the right of your lane.
column8: speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.

column2: 5. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 6. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: solid or broken yellow
column8: single broken yellow

column2: 7. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column4: Time
column8: Drinking coffee

column2: 8. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: on multiple lane highways.
column8: at most intersections.

column2: 9. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: pedestrians.
column8: street lights.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Winding road ahead.

column2: 11. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column6: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column8: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column10: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.

column2: 12. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 13. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 14. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 15. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column8: Drivers are not required to stop.
column10: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Crossing
column8: Intersection

column2: 17. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: School zone
column8: Speed limit

column2: 18. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the law.

column2: 19. You must yield to pedestrians when:
column4: the pedestrian is a blind person walking with a guide dog or white cane.
column6: you are entering a street from an alley or driveway.
column8: the pedestrian is in an unmarked crosswalk at an intersection.

column2: 20. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 21. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.
column6: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.
column8: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.

column2: 22. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column10: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Lane ends
column8: Two way Traffic

column2: 24. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: slow down before entering the curve.
column8: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 25. Worn tires:
column4: can make turning more difficult.
column6: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.
column8: can increase your stopping distance.

column2: 26. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a stop sign is posted.

column2: 27. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the right.
column6: The car that is traveling faster.
column8: The car approaching from the left.
column10: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: Merging traffic

column2: 29. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: are changing lanes.
column8: have your emergency brake on.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column8: Watch for bicycles

column2: 31. Your BAC depends on:
column4: your weight.
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 32. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the stop line.
column8: Before the crosswalk.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed

column2: 34. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column6: pass the car on the left.
column8: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 35. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: once you see the toll booth.
column10: when you first see the exit sign.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: The left lane ends soon
column8: Highway entrance ramp ahead

column2: 37. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 38. Speed limit signs are:
column4: destination signs (guide signs)
column8: service signs

column2: 39. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
